channel.title: Stupid Computer Courses
channel.description:
I signed up for Computer Studies this year to take a look at how my highschool is with computers etc.
What I found, aggravated me a lot.
1. The teacher doesn't have a clue. He really doesn't. He understand basic programming concepts, but he doesn't know what IDE stands for and he thinks Visual Basic (not .NET) is completely object oriented etc etc. It pisses me off a lot but I do not like challenging teachers as it never ends well for me.
2. From grades 10-12 the only language they teach is Visual Basic. Enough said.
I'm not sure what to do, taking it to grade 12 might look nice on an application to a post-secondary school since I plan on working in the computer programming field.
However, the classes make me rip the hair from my skull, and I'm not sure if it's worth sticking with.
Have any of you guys had an experience like myself? How did you handle it?
What should I do?

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

My teacher calls a USB stick a “memory dick”

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Thankfully we’ve done Java (and some others) at school.
Too bad we had to use software which was 7 years old, and the JDK that came with it was 7 years old as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Absolute Computer Programming doesn’t start until Year 10 at my school.

Year 9 IT includes MS Office, Adobe Photoshop, Flash and HTML.

Year 10 IT Programming includes Visual Studio (VB, VC++ and VC#), Database Programming and HTML.

I’m unsure in what is included in Year 11 & 12 IT Programming since I am in Year 10. I guess the teachers are OK and have a good idea of what they are doing at my school although they do get lost in some areas.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

my school also sux cox at programming courses,

they fucking teach .net in computer science, and no more. i took web design last year, and nobody fucking knew (including the teacher) what languages like jsp, asp, etc were and how they functioned

it was a fkn piss off, but you deal with it

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:14, topic:301982”]My school is actually very logical when it comes to programming. First you get introduced into visual basic (age 14-15) and start doing shit there, then move onto c# (15-16)which is slightly more complex before learning a proper language: C++ (16+)

For some weird reason there is that shit introduction program to java called “Greenfoot” however I have no indication that we will ever learn java (It’s probably there to teach good programming habits).[/quote]My old school was Visual Basic, then C++, then Java. I was happy with that, I could survive a year of visual basic even though I thought they should teach something like C# the first year.

Regardless, I got expelled so meh, I’m stuck with this now

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

My school is actually very logical when it comes to programming. First you get introduced into visual basic (age 14-15) and start doing shit there, then move onto c# (15-16)which is slightly more complex before learning a proper language: C++ (16+)

For some weird reason there is that shit introduction program to java called “Greenfoot” however I have no indication that we will ever learn java (It’s probably there to teach good programming habits).

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

My school offers Honors E-Commerce 1 and 2 and in 2 they pair you up with a business and you make a site for them.

I don’t think my school has a languages like java, vb ect.
We just have computer networking, engineering and computer apps (word, power point ect)

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

You don’t have shit on my school. Our only language (Java) was taken out this year so I’ve been in HTML for two years and since I’m more experienced with it than the other kids I was forced into remaking the Middle/High school website.

EDIT: My teacher thought Java script was Java.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

fellixombc:

Yeah my teacher still makes me type although I typed 86 wpm on a test >.>

I have my hands about an inch above the keyboard when i type, and i do it in a poking type motion but with all my fingers, so she made me redo it when i got 96… and i got a 24 when i redid it.

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:301982”][quote author=the bank link=topic=398319.msg2955517#msg2955517 date=1252804997]
My teacher told us that the mother board is actually the computer case because it houses everything. Beat that.
[/quote]

I can beat it, back in high school our teacher was complaining about spy-ware on her computer. My friend and I told her to install adaware (the best there was at the time) to remove it, she installed it, then came back to school the next day and yelled at us a lot saying she did research and discovered that ad-ware was bad and the same as spy-ware. We explained to her that the program was adaware and not ad-ware, that it removed ad-ware, but she still didn’t believe us and stayed angry.

If I were you I’d just skip the programming courses in high school, none were offered at my high school and I still got into college just fine. My brother has taken 2 in high school and it’s like yours, VB6 is what they use and it is useless.[/quote]Well, it is too late to drop the course now. I am just going to have to hold out for the rest of the year and see how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

the bank:

My teacher told us that the mother board is actually the computer case because it houses everything. Beat that.

I can beat it, back in high school our teacher was complaining about spy-ware on her computer. My friend and I told her to install adaware (the best there was at the time) to remove it, she installed it, then came back to school the next day and yelled at us a lot saying she did research and discovered that ad-ware was bad and the same as spy-ware. We explained to her that the program was adaware and not ad-ware, that it removed ad-ware, but she still didn’t believe us and stayed angry.

If I were you I’d just skip the programming courses in high school, none were offered at my high school and I still got into college just fine. My brother has taken 2 in high school and it’s like yours, VB6 is what they use and it is useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Stupid Computer Courses
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:1, topic:301982”]I signed up for Computer Studies this year to take a look at how my highschool is with computers etc.

What I found, aggravated me a lot.

  1. The teacher doesn’t have a clue. He really doesn’t. He understand basic programming concepts, but he doesn’t know what IDE stands for and he thinks Visual Basic (not .NET) is completely object oriented etc etc. It pisses me off a lot but I do not like challenging teachers as it never ends well for me.

  2. From grades 10-12 the only language they teach is Visual Basic. Enough said.

I’m not sure what to do, taking it to grade 12 might look nice on an application to a post-secondary school since I plan on working in the computer programming field.

(By the way if the class is easy, and you ace it, it’ll be better for you. Especially if you can jump 1 year ahead)

However, the classes make me rip the hair from my skull, and I’m not sure if it’s worth sticking with.

Have any of you guys had an experience like myself? How did you handle it?

What should I do?[/quote]
Yeah well so far I’m taking a computer engineer class and in 2weeks of school we’ve done 1 power point. Well just take the best classes for computers that you can. You should stick with it until the end of it because it will look bad ass (in a good way) on your application. And if you take private lessons it’s even better if you can get it on there

Read full topic
